audio_descriptions.notes:
(Extended Description)
Materials needed:
12oz aluminum soda can
Two bottle caps from 16 oz plastic soda bottles
Scissors
2 bobby pins
5 rubber bands (3-5 inches)
*Razor blade - *Safety warning-Please make sure to have an adult assist with the cutting of the razor blade and use of the hot glue gun to ensure the child’s safety.*
Hot glue gun
Confetti
Matt to place confetti on
12 inch long metal rod (approximately ½ inch thick) with a hooked end


0.5: With the 12oz aluminum soda can poke a one inch diameter hole in the bottom center of the can with scissors.

0.25 & repeats at 0.35: Take the plastic bottle caps from 16 oz. soft drinks and use the point of the scissors to poke a ½ inch hole. Twist the scissor tip to make the hole.

Take the plastic bottle caps from 16 oz. soft drinks and use the point of the scissors to poke a ½ inch hole. Twist the scissor tip to make the hole. 
 Set those aside.

0.40: Take the five rubber bands and thread inside one side of the bobby pin. You should be able to stretch the rubber bands tight by pulling the bobby pin.

0.45: Pull the bobby pin and rubber bands that hang on it half way through the hole in one of the bottle caps.

0.49 Take a small metal rod that is as wide as the bottle cap and place it inside the bottle cap and underneath the rubber bands to secure them.

0.50: Remove the bobby pin, by pulling it towards it’s open side while leaving the rubber band still in the bottle cap hole.

1.00: Loop the bobby pin that was laid aside through the middle of the exposed end of the rubber bands.

1.10: Extend the same bobby pin through the hole on the outer facing middle of the second bottle cap.

1:15: Both bottle caps are now positioned next to each other and connected by the rubber band.

1:18 Remove the bobby pin from the rubber band

1:20 The video shows bottle caps secured by the metal rod we used earlier.

1:25: Take the small curved end of the 16 inch metal rod and place all of the rubber bands through the hook of the rod and pull tight

1:30: Take the aluminum soda can and place the long straight end of the rod through the entire soda can.

1:35: Pull the metal rod out at the end with the drinking tab.

1:40  Hold the rubber bands in your index finger and wrap rubber bands around the drinking tab and push down to secure and remove the metal hook.

1:55: The video shows the two bottle caps secured to the bottom of the soda can.
1:57: Flip can over to where the bottle caps are attached, facing you.

1:57: Flip can over so the bottle caps are attached, facing you.

1:59: With one hand, hold the soda can and with the other hand, move it in a circular motion while hot gluing around the edges of the newly attached bottle caps.

Place the soda can in an easily accessible place for later use.**This next part will require the use of the X-Acto knife. . Please be cautious.

2:08: Grab the plastic bottle and place it width wise in front of you On a flat surface With one hand, hold onto the bottle. With the other hand grab the handle of the X-Acto knife and place the tip of the razor( facing downward) about 6 inches from the top of the bottle.

Cut in a circular motion all the way around the bottle until 2 parts are created. 

2:14: Separate the cut bottle.

 Keep the top half with the bottle neck. Pull off any plastic wrapping attached to the bottle piece and discard.

2:23: With one hand, hold the plastic bottle piece with the neck facing down and away from you.Turn the piece until it is at a 2 o’clock position.

2:24: With your other hand, take scissors and cut in a circular motion around the open end. Do this all the way around.

2:32: Flip the bottle piece so the neck is in an upward position.  Turn the piece to a 10 o’clock position. With the scissors, cut from the large circular open end to the neck of the bottle, to make strips approximately 2 inches wide.  Do this all the way around.

2:35:Flip the bottle piece again, so the  neck is facing down and away from you. Starting at the top of the newly cut pieces, peel and bend them back, as far as they will go. A fan like shape has now been created.

2:40: Keep the plastic bottle piece facing down. Take the scissors and cut around the edges of the fan pieces to create a circular edge.

2:59: Find the soda can. Place it width wise in front of you.

3:01: Place the neck of the plastic bottle piece into the attached bottle caps on the soda can. Turn the soda can until the cut plastic bottle piece stays in place.

3:08: twist the soda can while holding the top in your hand in a clockwise position for at least 10 turns.

3:15: Place some confetti/pieces of paper on a matt in front of you.

3:25: Holds the sides of the can to release the air pressure that has built up inside. The air will now be released, and the plastic strips will move in a circular motion, blowing away the confetti.

3:27 and 3:33: Repeat this process to feel the fan blow again

3:40: End of the video-graphics are shown thanking you for watching this video.

1:59 With one hand, hold the soda can and with the other hand, move it in a circular motion while hot gluing around the edges of the newly attached bottle caps. Place the soda can in an easily accessible place for later use. **Please note, the next part will require the use of the X-Acto knife. Please make sure to have an adult assist you.**

2:08 Grab the plastic bottle and place it width wise in front if you. On a flat surface (such as a table). with one hand, hold onto the bottle. With the other hand, grab the handle of the X-Acto knife and place the tip of the razor (facing downward) approximately 6 inches from the top of the bottle. Start cutting in a circular motion all the way around the bottle until 2 parts are created. Hand the handle of the X-Acto knife(with the razor facing downward) back to the adult and place it in a safe place, (preferably with the razor covered for later use).

2:14 Separate the cut bottle. Keep the top half with the bottle neck.

2:20 Pull off any plastic wrapping attached to the bottle and discard.

2:23 With one hand, hold the plastic bottle piece with the neck facing down and away from you. Turn the piece until it is in a 2 o'clock position.

2:24 with your other hand, take a pair if scissors and cut in a circular motion around the open end. Do this all the way around.

2:32 Flip the bottle piece again, so the neck is in a upward position. Slightly turn the piece until it is in a 10 o'clock position. With the scissors, cut from the large circular open end to the neck of the bottle, to make strips approximately 2 inches wide. Do this all the way around.

2:35 Flip the bottle piece again, so the neck is facing down and away from you. Starting at the top of the newly cut pieces, peel and bend them back, as far as they will go. A fan like shape has now been created.

2:40 Keep the plastic bottle facing down. Take the scissors and cut around the edges of the fan pieces to create a circular edge.

2:54 Find the soda can. Place it width wise in front of you.

3:00 Place the neck of the plastic bottle piece into the attached bottle caps on the soda can. Turn the soda can until the plastic bottle piece stats in place.

3:08 With one hand, hold onto the newly connected plastic bottle side. With the other hand, twist the soda can in a clockwise position for at least 10 turns.

3:15 Place some confetti/pieces of paper on a Matt in front of you.

3:25 Squeeze the soda can to release the air pressure that has built up inside. The air will now be released, and the plastic strips will move in a circular motion, blowing away the debris in front of you.

3:27 and 3:33 The process is repeated two times

3:40 End of video graphics are displayed thanking you for watching this vides.
